newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel union's declare crippling nationwide strike.
newsitem.headline: Israel union's declare crippling nationwide strike.

text.p: Israeli unions will launch a potentially crippling nationwide strike on Thursday to support communications workers battling privatisation moves, a union leader said on Wednesday.

"The workers of the Israel Electric Company, the military industry, Israel Aircraft Industries, the Postal Authority, the railroads will not be at their posts tomorrow," said Shlomo Shani, a senior official of the powerful Histadrut labour federation.

Israel Radio said workers at airports, oil refineries and other state-owned institutions would also take part in the open-ended strike, slated to begin at 7 a.m. (0400 gmt). In all, some 60,000 workers will be striking, it said.

The strike was declared hours after the Israeli government issued an order to force hundreds of Bezeq Israel Telecom employees to restore essential telephone services after strikers refused to comply fully with a back-to-work court order.

Union leaders at Israel's main telecoms provider called the move "totalitarian" and said a crisis continued over government plans to privatise more of the state-owned company through the $250 million sale of 12.5 percent of its stock to Merrill Lynch.

The week-long Bezeq strike has left thousands of homes and businesses without full telephone services and forced the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange to halt trading on Tuesday. Disruptions continued on Wednesday but the bourse reopened for business.

Union leaders said the Merrill Lynch deal violated government promises to involve Bezeq workers in all aspects of the company's privatisation and called for the sale to be cancelled or to use its revenues to fund early pension
